name: ConMan
body:
ConMan is a serial console management program designed to support a large number of console devices and simultaneous users.

It supports:

  * local serial devices
  * remote terminal servers (via the telnet protocol)
  * IPMI Serial-Over-LAN (via [FreeIPMI](https://www.gnu.org/software/freeipmi/))
  * Unix domain sockets
  * external processes (e.g., Expect for telnet/ssh/ipmi-sol connections)

Its features include:

  * logging (and optionally timestamping) console device output to file
  * connecting to consoles in monitor (R/O) or interactive (R/W) mode
  * allowing clients to share or steal console write privileges
  * broadcasting client output to multiple consoles

Links:

* [Download](../releases/latest)
* [Issue Tracker](../issues)
